column4: guys why does my fresh ubuntu 10.10 netbook install look like the desktop version?
do you need to load graphic drivers?
also at the login screen there is a button after you choose or type you name for desktop choice, are you sure it is the netbook verson?
this command in the terminal will identify the graphic card   lspci | grep VGA
after typing "lspci | grep VGA" terminal says "00:02 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation 82852/855GM Integrated Graphics Device (rev 02)"
did you look in the menu-system-admin-additional drivers
it says "no propietary drivers are in use on this system"
I would reboot it or logout to the login in window and type or choose your name and check the buttons for the netbook desktop.
at the bottom of the screen it says "Ubuntu Desktop Edition" how can I install the netbook edition?
I'm not sure to tell you the truth it is the unity desktop
I don't know how, and the netbook desktop is called unity
is there a way to solve this problem
when i logout it says ubuntu desktop edition, not ubuntu netbook edition
do you hava link to the cd you downloaded
thats the netbook version, not really sure use the Ubuntu forums for help as well, I have to crash.
